page.title: 12Visiting a Farm
page.content: All Class 2 went to Whittlesford farms. At one farm we saw the combine and at another we saw some rare {sheep.}Every time we go to a farm it is fun. The farm has{winter wheat, {spring wheat, sugar beet, barley}and some{oats}which are grown for Quaker porridge oats. (A firm that makes cereals). These crops are called arable which means that it is plant life. There are hardly any animals. The farm has some{oilseed rape.}When it is flowering it is yellow. In some patches it is more yellow because the pigeons have stripped off the green leaves. When it is harvested it is the colour of a hare's back. You can't grow barley anymore because you can't get any money out of it.
